column4: Hey, can can anyone help me out with a networking problem? I'm new to Ubuntu/Linux and its bafiling me
can you describe the the problem?

Ite, well I just dual booted by desktop with Ubuntu and Win7 and im connected over ethernet to my router and the problem I'm having is in Win7 my speedtest.net speeds are 20mbps but when I go into Ubuntu I'm only getting about 1.5mbps... I really cant even search the internet... Also pings are not working in Ubuntu to other PC's on lan or to the wlan
did u see the description i posted?
where?

Ite, well I just dual booted by desktop with Ubuntu and Win7 and im connected over ethernet to my router and the problem I'm having is in Win7 my speedtest.net speeds are 20mbps but when I go into Ubuntu I'm only getting about 1.5mbps... I really cant even search the internet... Also pings are not working in Ubuntu to other PC's on lan or to the wlan
well faster is one thing.. but its like dial bs broadband
vs*
its the same on 10.10 live or install
:/ dam would trying 11.04 make a difference?
are you sure you're actually connected?  Can you log in to your router?
Quick, do you have more than one network jack on your pc?
no i cannot login to th erouter
annd No just one network port
Quick, I take it you're on another machine or in W7?
Ya, I'm on my laptop right now pac1
Ok,  go on the assumtion that the speed test did not actually test anything.
That it did not connect.
Can you connect to anything on the net?
well no, I am getting internet speedtest.net did run and I can browse other websites
I just cannot ping anything on the network, pull up the router website
log into your router from your laptop and see if it is seeing your Linux box?
ya it was registering
